skills.name: Simplify algebraic expressions to maintain equivalence by collecting like terms involving just one linear variable
Simplify algebraic expressions to maintain equivalence by collecting like terms involving non-linear variables

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you have just used the number in front of the second bracket. Remember you will get xs from the first bracket too
explanations.B: The first bracket will give us 10x and then we need to subtract 4x leaving us with 6x
explanations.C: Almost, just be careful to take into account the - between the two brackets
explanations.D: I think you have found the difference between the constants in the brackets. Look at how many xs you would get if you expanded and simplified

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember the numbers Infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the numbers Infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside, also take note of the - between the brackets
explanations.C: Almost, just be careful to take into account the - between the two brackets
explanations.D: The first bracket gives us 12x, and then we need to take away the 2x given by the second bracket. This leaves us with 10x

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember the numbers infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the numbers infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside, also take note of the - between the brackets
explanations.C: Almost, just be careful to take into account the - between the two brackets
explanations.D: The first bracket gives us 8, and then we take away the -28 from the second bracket. This gives us 8 - - 28 = 8 + 28 = 36

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember the numbers Infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside, also take note of the - between the brackets
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the numbers Infront of the bracket will need to be multiplied by everything inside

explanations.A: The only place that will give us x squared terms is the first bracket. x multiplied by 2x will give us 2 x squared, so the answer is 2
explanations.B: I think you might have combined the terms in the first bracket, but they are not like terms so we can't add them. Remember we only want x squared terms.
explanations.C: I think you have just added the x terms. Remember everything inside the bracket is multiplied by what is on the outside. Also we are only interested in x squared terms
explanations.D: Not quite, the second bracket won't give us any x squared terms.

explanations.A: Not quite, the second bracket won't give us any x squared terms.
explanations.B: I think you have combined your x and x squared terms, we are only interested in the x squared that comes from the first bracket
explanations.C: I think you have just added the x terms. Remember everything inside the bracket is multiplied by what is on the outside. Also we are only interested in x squared terms
explanations.D: The only place that will give us x squared terms is the first bracket. x multiplied by 3x will give us 3 x squared, so the answer is 3

explanations.A: The first bracket gives us -x and the second gives us 12x, so in total we have 11x
explanations.B: I think you have added the 3 and 4 here. Remember we multiply everything outside the bracket by what is inside. Is this the only part that will give you an x term?
explanations.C: I think you have found the constant term here, we are interested in the x terms
explanations.D: I think you have only taken the x terms from the second bracket. There will be some from the first bracket too

explanations.A: I think you have found the P, we are interested in Q which is the x term
explanations.B: The first bracket gives us -5x and the second gives us 12x. -5 + 12 = 7
explanations.C: I think you have combined the x squared term with the x term. We are only interested in the x terms.
explanations.D: Almost, just remember there is a - in front of the 5 in the first brackets

explanations.A: I think you forgot to multiply by the number outside the bracket.
explanations.B: I think you combined the -1 and -2 in the two brackets. Remember everything inside the bracket is multiplied by what is on the outside.
explanations.C: I think you included the -1 from the first bracket, but this is -1x. We are only interested in the constant terms
explanations.D: We don't get any constant terms from the first bracket, only from the second which gives us 3 x -2 = -6

explanations.A: I think you included the -5 from the first bracket, but this is -5x. We are only interested in the constant terms
explanations.B: We don't get any constant terms from the first bracket, only from the second which gives us 6 x -3 = -18
explanations.C: I think you combined the -5 and -3 in the two brackets. Remember everything inside the bracket is multiplied by what is on the outside.
explanations.D: I think you forgot to multiply by the number outside the bracket.
